meanings.sent1: The city council suburbanised the area by adding more parks and quiet streets.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was suburbanised with the construction of new single-family homes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids suburbanised the playground by planting mini-gardens in every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her smile suburbanised the room, filling it with warmth and friendliness.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes suburbanised the canvas, turning it into a peaceful suburban scene.

meanings.sent1: The old factory was suburbanised into a trendy shopping district.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to suburbanise the outskirts of the city for better urban planning.
meanings.sent3: The magician suburbanised the hat into a tiny suburban house, complete with a tiny garden.
meanings.sent4: Her words suburbanised his thoughts, transforming them into peaceful suburban streets.
meanings.sent5: The chef suburbanised the plain dish into a gourmet meal fit for a suburban feast.

meanings.sent1: The real estate company suburbanised the rural land, creating new housing developments.
meanings.sent2: The government's initiative aimed to suburbanise the region for better population distribution.
meanings.sent3: The aliens suburbanised the barren planet, building colorful suburban communities.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas suburbanised the project, expanding it into multiple suburban areas.
meanings.sent5: The company's expansion suburbanised the market, reaching out to new suburban customers.
